text: BTS, one of South Korea's biggest K-pop boy bands, are having a major breakout moment in the U.S. The group made history tonight when they performed at the American Music Awards. They are one of the first K-pop groups to ever do so, and this also marks the group's first U.S. TV performance. Jin, Suga, J-Hope, RM, Jimin, V, and Jungkook did "DNA," their single that is the highest-charting ever for a k-pop group on the Billboard Hot 100. See a clip of their next-level dancing below: Ansel Elgort was super into it: Alyssa Bailey is the senior news and strategy editor at ELLE.com, where she oversees coverage of celebrities and royals (particularly Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton). She previously held positions at InStyle and Cosmopolitan. When she's not working, she loves running around Central Park, making people take #ootd pics of her, and exploring New York City. title: BTS Performs at AMAs - K-Pop Group BTS Makes U.S. TV Debut at American Music Awards 2017
